data.text: @Loretta_Torrago @FrankCianfrani @apsmunro Thanks! Larry Kramer: “I called Dr. Fauci a murderer many times,”  (ed- eugenicist is not much worse) “Dr. Fauci has become the only true and great hero in all of this [hiv/aids], in the government, in the system. … I acknowledge him every chance I can”. https://t.co/JSdUbZLsIh

@jeffreytran @FrankCianfrani @apsmunro I think it was my sincerity that sent me to Munro's chopping block honestly. 
The "Fauci is not a eugenicist" hill is a surprisingly banal, if good, hill to die on. Well done!

@Loretta_Torrago @FrankCianfrani @apsmunro No, I was completely sincere. Then left. I don’t really keep track of these people. The first person to ever block me was because I suggested that Anthony Fauci was not proposing eugenics to congress but explaining how epidemics work. But I get the rage, makes sense.

@e_dantonio @apsmunro I don't know why it doesn't occur to them: "If I have to misinterpret to have a case, maybe I don't have one."
I mean, that's an option.
@FrankCianfrani @Loretta_Torrago @apsmunro The first time I ran across him I got alert and responded, if that’s right we need to figure out the mechanism! That seems not to be his thing.

@Loretta_Torrago @apsmunro Oh, @apsmunro - the guy who gaslit the world into believing that kids can't catch or spread covid and that schools are the safest place in the world to be? One and the same?
